metadata.title: CVE-2023-32668 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
LuaTeX before 1.17.0 allows a document (compiled with the default settings)to make arbitrary network requests. This occurs because full access to thesocket library is permitted by default, as stated in the documentation.This also affects TeX Live before 2023 r66984 and MiKTeX before 23.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkpathsea6 - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
libptexenc1 - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
libsynctex2 - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
libtexlua53 - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
libtexluajit2 - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
texlive-binaries - 2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: texlive-bin package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2019.20190605.51237-3ubuntu0.2').
